headline: Ford Battery Plant Will Still Get Credits Under GOP Bill, Company Says
summary: Ford Motor said it was “on track” to qualify for lucrative, Biden-era federal tax credits for electric-vehicle batteries it plans to make at a new, $3 billion plant in Michigan, even under President Trump’s new tax bill.  The automaker’s chairman had said the under-construction factory was “imperiled” because an earlier version of the “big, beautiful bill” would have rendered the factory ineligible for credits because of Ford’s reliance on a Chinese partner.  Ford is licensing technology from leading Chinese battery maker CATL for the cells it will make at the plant, as well as for the plant’s production process.

raw.headline: Ford Battery Plant Will Still Get Credits Under GOP Bill, Company Says

Ford is licensing technology from leading Chinese battery maker CATL for the cells it will make at the plant, as well as for the plant’s production process.

headline: Ford Motor (NYSE:F) Unveils Affordable eBike Leasing Program at US$75 a Month
summary: Ford Motor (NYSE:F) recently reported a 33% increase in share price over the last quarter, a period marked by key developments that may have bolstered investor confidence. Notably, Ford announced its partnership with n+ to launch an affordable eBike financing and leasing program, a move resonating with the shift towards sustainable transportation solutions. Meanwhile, the broader market has shown modest upward movement, largely flat over recent days but demonstrating a 13% rise over the year...

headline: Ford says Michigan EV battery plant 'on track' for production tax credits
summary: (Reuters) -Ford Motor said Tuesday it believes its planned $3 billion Michigan electric vehicle battery plant, which is 60% complete, will qualify for production tax credits after a massive tax and budget bill revised the rules.  In May, Ford had sounded the alarm over the potential for the U.S. government to eliminate production tax credits that support the manufacturing of electric vehicle batteries using Chinese technology in the House version of legislation.  Ford said Tuesday the Marshall, Michigan plant that is slated to employ 1,700 workers "is on track to qualify for the production tax credit -- a win for our customers and a win for American competitiveness."

raw.headline: Ford says Michigan EV battery plant 'on track' for production tax credits
raw.summary: (Reuters) -Ford Motor said Tuesday it believes its planned $3 billion Michigan electric vehicle battery plant, which is 60% complete, will qualify for production tax credits after a massive tax and budget bill revised the rules.  In May, Ford had sounded the alarm over the potential for the U.S. government to eliminate production tax credits that support the manufacturing of electric vehicle batteries using Chinese technology in the House version of legislation.  Ford said Tuesday the Marshall, Michigan plant that is slated to employ 1,700 workers "is on track to qualify for the production tax credit -- a win for our customers and a win for American competitiveness."

headline: Percepta Celebrates 25 Years of Transforming Automotive Customer Experience
summary: Percepta, a customer experience (CX) leader purpose-built for the automotive industry, is celebrating 25 years of transforming customer engagement for premiere car brands across the globe. Launched in 1999 as a joint venture between TTEC Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ: TTEC) and Ford, Percepta has evolved into a global CX partner operating in 13 countries and 60 markets, delivering seamless experiences across multiple channels—from voice and chat to email, social, and app-based support.
